Ingredients.food_item: white bread flour, plus more for dusting
nstant yeast or bread machine yeast
dry fermented cider (may substitute Pilsener beer; see headnote)
lukewarm water (80 degrees), plus an optional 1 tablespoon

KD.Directions: Whisk together the flours, yeast and saltin a mixing bowl Combine the cider and water in a liquid measuring cup Add the liquid to the flour mixture; use a spatula or bench scraper or your hand moistened with water to blend them for about a minute The dough should be shaggy yet cohesive Cover the bowl with a towel ; let the dough rest for 20 Moisten your kneading hand If the dough seems stiff, add the optional tablespoon of water Stretch one edge of the dough, then press it into the center of the bowl Repeat this about a dozen times, moving clockwise to catch all sides of the dough This should take 1 or 2 Turn the dough over so the seams are on the bottom Cover and let rest for 20 minutes Repeat the clockwise stretching and folding two more times, with 20-minute rests after each Cover and refrigerate at least 8 to 24 The dough should have doubled If it hasn't, leave it on the counter until it does Lightly flour a work surface Use a pastry cloth or clean dish towel to line a round colander Dust the cloth with flour Transfer the dough to the floured work surface Fold the edges toward the center to create a round shape, turning it over so the seams are on the bottom. Let it rest for 5 then transfer to the colander, seam side up. Cover with a towel and let the dough rise for 1 1/2 Thirty before baking, place a cast-iron Dutch oven (lid on) or enameled cast-iron pot with a lid (on) in the oven; preheat to 475 degrees Carefully remove the hot pot from the oven Turn the dough out onto the counter so the seams are on the bottom. Use kitchen scissors to make 8 on the top of the dough in an evenly spaced spoke pattern, each about 1/4 Lift the dough and carefully drop it into the hot pot. Immediately cover with the hot lid. Bake for 30 , then reduce the heat to 450 Uncover and bake for 8 to 10 or until the crust is dark brown. Try to minimize the amount of time the oven door is open The bread is done when its internal temperature registers 205 degrees on an instant-read thermometer and the loaf sounds hollow when knocked on the underside. Transfer the loaf to a wire rack to cool for at least 1 before cutting.
